market_summary: XRP down 6.4% to $1.34 amid extreme fear (F&G: 5). ETF outflows accelerated to -$7.9K daily, -$5.5M weekly, signaling institutional retreat.
thesis_pulse: SBI ¥10B blockchain bond with XRP rewards strengthens Japan adoption thesis ahead of schedule. However, accelerating ETF outflows (-$5.5M weekly) and extreme fear environment (F&G: 5) indicate institutional confidence wavering. RLUSD at $1.56B (31% of kill switch target) continues steady growth. PermissionedDEX live but institutional adoption data still missing.

stress_assessment.interpretation: USD/JPY at 155.21 breaches elevated threshold. JGB yields at 2.24% in critical range. Extreme fear (F&G: 5) compounds macro stress environment.

scorecard_updates.reasoning: SBI ¥10B blockchain bond with XRP rewards represents concrete institutional integration beyond earlier positioning

alerts.message: ETF outflows accelerating: -$5.5M weekly across multiple funds during extreme fear
SBI Holdings ¥10B blockchain bond with XRP rewards strengthens Japan adoption case

etf_analysis: Accelerating outflows (-$5.5M weekly, -$7.9K daily) across multiple funds signal institutional retreat. Only Canary Capital showing outflows while others flat suggests concentrated selling pressure.
macro_analysis: Elevated stress persists with USD/JPY 155.21, JGB yields 2.24% in critical range, and extreme fear (F&G: 5). Oil at $69.77 provides some relief from energy shock risks.

recommended_probability_adjustment.reasoning: SBI bond launch validates Japan adoption thesis, shifting 5% from base to mid despite ETF outflow headwinds

events_draft.title: SBI Holdings Launches ¥10B Blockchain Bond With XRP Rewards
events_draft.expanded: Major Japanese financial institution deepens XRPL integration with tokenized bonds offering XRP rewards, advancing Japan adoption thesis ahead of Q3 timeline.

geopolitical_watchlist.status_text: JGB yields at 2.24% in critical range while SBI advances blockchain bond integration.
Strait of Hormuz critical status continues with dual carrier presence.
Section 122 tariff framework active with 150-day expiration countdown.
10% global tariffs under Section 122 expire approximately July 20, 2026.
Russia-Iran-China joint exercises maintain elevated tensions.

energy_interpretation: Brent at $69.77 provides relief from earlier energy shock fears, reducing pressure on Japan's trade deficit feedback loop. However, USD/JPY at 155.21 and JGB yields at 2.24% indicate BOJ credibility stress continues despite lower oil prices.
thesis_pulse_assessment: SBI ¥10B blockchain bond with XRP rewards validates Japan adoption thesis ahead of schedule. RLUSD growth to $1.56B (31% of kill switch) maintains momentum. However, accelerating ETF outflows (-$5.5M weekly) during extreme fear (F&G: 5) signal institutional confidence erosion. Core ODL volume data gap persists.
stress_interpretation: Elevated stress environment with USD/JPY 155.21 breaching threshold and JGB yields 2.24% in critical range. Extreme fear index at 5 indicates broad market stress, though Brent at $69.77 provides some energy relief.

bear_case.score_reasoning: ETF outflows accelerating (-$5.5M weekly) during extreme fear (F&G: 5) suggest institutional retreat overcoming adoption news momentum.

bear_case.bear_narrative: Accelerating ETF outflows (-$5.5M weekly) during extreme fear override SBI adoption signals. Institutional retreat velocity suggests confidence eroding faster than positive news can rebuild it. BIS Project Nexus represents credible bypass threat to XRPL bridge utility.
